# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a simple implementation of the `wrap_string` function, taking into account the provided parameters:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in eachword(lowercase(text)))
        # Ensure that the current line won't exceed the text width
        if endof(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = string(word)
        else
            current_line = current_line * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line to the result
    push!(lines, current_line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
This function will take a text as input and wrap it at the specified `text_width`. It'll add new lines between each wrapped part.
